headline.main: Spending More Doesn't Make Us Healthier

docs.abstract: Few understand how much we spend on health care, how much we need to spend to provide quality care, and the difference between the two.
docs.snippet: Few understand how much we spend on health care, how much we need to spend to provide quality care, and the difference between the two.

docs.lead_paragraph: If you have heard it once, you have heard it hundreds of times. "The United States spends too much on health care." This is not a partisan point. You can hear this from Republicans as well as Democrats. "We know that our families, our economy and our nation itself will not succeed in the 21st century if we continue to be held down by the weight of rapidly rising health care costs," President Obama said in 2009. Representative Paul D. Ryan, Republican of Wisconsin, agrees: "There is no serious dispute - on either side of the aisle."

docs.lead_paragraph: The vaccine will protect against cancers that can result from sexual activity, a federal advisory committee said.

headline.seo: Panel Recommends HPV Vaccine for Boys and Young Men
headline.main: Panel Endorses HPV Vaccine for Boys of 11
headline.print_headline: Panel Endorses HPV Vaccine For Boys of 11

docs.abstract: Federal advisory panel says boys and young men should be vaccinated against human papillomavirus to protect against anal and throat cancers that can result from sexual activity; recommendation by panel, Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices of the Centers for Disease Control, is likely to transform use of HPV vaccine, which has been until now suggested for young girls.
docs.snippet: The vaccine will protect against cancers that can result from sexual activity, a federal advisory committee said.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Women infected with HPV are two to three times as likely as uninfected women to have had a heart attack or stroke, a new report says.

headline.seo: HPV Is Linked to Heart Disease in Women
headline.main: Troubles With Heart Are Linked to HPV
headline.print_headline: Troubles With Heart Are Linked To HPV

docs.abstract: Study in The Journal of the American College of Cardiology suggests HPV may increase chances of heart disease by suppressing an important gene.
docs.snippet: Women infected with HPV are two to three times as likely as uninfected women to have had a heart attack or stroke, a new report says.
